definition: across one's whole face/(smiling) from ear to ear
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc
scowling in anger/rage written across one's face

sentences.english: The young farmer smiled a springtime smile.
sentences.chinese: 那年輕的農夫滿面春風地笑了。

sentences.english: Nancy was all smiles when she saw Tom.
sentences.chinese: 南希一見湯姆就滿面笑容。

sentences.english: She became so happy and smiled, saying 'I'll take it right now.'
sentences.chinese: 她非常高興，笑容滿面，說道‘我現在就賣。’

sentences.english: When I got there she smiled again, and handed me a boarding pass.
sentences.chinese: 在櫃檯前她笑容滿面地遞給我一張登機牌。

sentences.english: Parents rushed out to meet the guest, all smiles.
sentences.chinese: 父母忙出去迎客，笑容滿面。

sentences.english: In the photo, Al-qaddafi's face is covered with blood, look trance.
sentences.chinese: 照片中，卡扎菲血流滿面，神色恍惚。

sentences.english: Carlo leaned back, his face flushed with gratification.
sentences.chinese: 卡羅靠在椅背上，感激涕零，滿面紅光。

sentences.english: She has a poor complexion and pock marks on her forehead.
sentences.chinese: 她滿面菜色，額頭上有些麻子。

sentences.english: Even if indifference, but he was always a limitless a faith gives teared up.
sentences.chinese: 縱使淡漠無邊，卻總有一種信仰讓淚流滿面。

sentences.english: My mother always seemed (to be) sad when I was young.
sentences.chinese: 我小時候，母親似乎總是愁容滿面。

sentences.english: His wide smile flaps loosely with each breath.
sentences.chinese: 他那滿面笑容隨着每次呼吸鬆弛地收放。

sentences.english: Bettie held her husband, with tears streaming down her face.
sentences.chinese: 貝蒂擁抱着她的丈夫，淚流滿面。

sentences.english: The poor girl was in tears.
sentences.chinese: 這個清苦女孩淚流滿面。

sentences.english: I cried in my apartment that night.
sentences.chinese: 晚上，我躲在單身公寓裏，淚流滿面。

sentences.english: Would you picture a grey-bearded, elderly gentleman perched on a throne?
sentences.chinese: 你會否想象一個白髮老人，滿面鬍子，坐在寶座上？

sentences.english: Practice your poker face; don't let them see you sweat.
sentences.chinese: 學會喜怒不形於色，別讓別人看出你愁容滿面。
